title: Mueller Agrees to Testify Before 2 House Panels Next Month
text: promise to be must-see television and hold the potential to reshape the political landscape
openFeedback: This dramatizes the hearings using emotional, entertainment-style language. It frames them as historic and sensational rather than presenting them neutrally.

title: Mueller Agrees to Testify Before 2 House Panels Next Month
text: Mueller, who has spoken publicly only once about his work, resisted taking the witness stand
openFeedback: By stressing his reluctance, the article introduces doubt about Mueller’s willingness to testify, subtly undermining the strength of his role.

title: Mueller Agrees to Testify Before 2 House Panels Next Month
text: The committee leaders have been under intense pressure from Democratic activists and their own rank-and-file members alike
openFeedback: The phrasing highlights broad collective demand, implying that public and political pressure makes Mueller’s testimony inevitable and widely desired.

title: Mueller Agrees to Testify Before 2 House Panels Next Month
text: Mueller and his team of prosecutors wanted to avoid a public spectacle
openFeedback: Calling the hearing a 'public spectacle' inflates its seriousness and dramatizes the motivations of Mueller’s team in exaggerated terms.

title: Mueller Agrees to Testify Before 2 House Panels Next Month
text: Republican-controlled Senate, where lawmakers in the majority were less insistent he appear
openFeedback: This reduces a complex political process to a simple partisan explanation, glossing over procedural and institutional considerations influencing Senate decisions.
